verses.verse: Then sang <S%H7891><s%> Deborah <S%H1683><s%> and Barak <S%H1301><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam <S%H42><s%> on that day <S%H3117><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>,
Praise <S%H1288><s%> ye the LORD <S%H3068><s%> for the avenging <S%H6544><s%> <S%H6546><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, when the people <S%H5971><s%> willingly offered <S%H5068><s%> themselves.

Hear <S%H8085><s%>, O ye kings <S%H4428><s%>; give ear <S%H238><s%>, O ye princes <S%H7336><s%>; I, even I, will sing <S%H7891><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; I will sing <S%H2167><s%> praise to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

LORD <S%H3068><s%>, when thou wentest out <S%H3318><s%> of Seir <S%H8165><s%>, when thou marchedst out <S%H6805><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> of Edom <S%H123><s%>, the earth <S%H776><s%> trembled <S%H7493><s%>, and the heavens <S%H8064><s%> dropped <S%H5197><s%>, the clouds <S%H5645><s%> also dropped <S%H5197><s%> water <S%H4325><s%>.

The mountains <S%H2022><s%> melted <S%H5140><s%> from before <S%H6440><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, even that Sinai <S%H5514><s%> from before <S%H6440><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

In the days <S%H3117><s%> of Shamgar <S%H8044><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Anath <S%H6067><s%>, in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Jael <S%H3278><s%>, the highways <S%H734><s%> were unoccupied <S%H2308><s%>, and the travellers <S%H1980><s%> walked <S%H3212><s%> through byways <S%H6128><s%> <S%H5410><s%>.

The inhabitants of the villages <S%H6520><s%> ceased <S%H2308><s%>, they ceased <S%H2308><s%> in Israel <S%H3478><s%>, until that I Deborah <S%H1683><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%>, that I arose <S%H6965><s%> a mother <S%H517><s%> in Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

They chose <S%H977><s%> new <S%H2319><s%> gods <S%H430><s%>; then was war <S%H3901><s%> in the gates <S%H8179><s%>: was there a shield <S%H4043><s%> or spear <S%H7420><s%> seen <S%H7200><s%> among forty <S%H705><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> in Israel <S%H3478><s%>?

My heart <S%H3820><s%> is toward the governors <S%H2710><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, that offered themselves willingly <S%H5068><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%>. Bless <S%H1288><s%> ye the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
Speak <S%H7878><s%>, ye that ride <S%H7392><s%> on white <S%H6715><s%> asses <S%H860><s%>, ye that sit <S%H3427><s%> in judgment <S%H4055><s%>, and walk <S%H1980><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%>.

They that are delivered from the noise <S%H6963><s%> of archers <S%H2686><s%> in the places of drawing water <S%H4857><s%>, there shall they rehearse <S%H8567><s%> the righteous acts <S%H6666><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, even the righteous acts <S%H6666><s%> toward the inhabitants of his villages <S%H6520><s%> in Israel <S%H3478><s%>: then shall the people <S%H5971><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> go down <S%H3381><s%> to the gates <S%H8179><s%>.

Awake <S%H5782><s%>, awake <S%H5782><s%>, Deborah <S%H1683><s%>: awake <S%H5782><s%>, awake <S%H5782><s%>, utter <S%H1696><s%> a song <S%H7892><s%>: arise <S%H6965><s%>, Barak <S%H1301><s%>, and lead thy captivity <S%H7628><s%> captive <S%H7617><s%>, thou son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam <S%H42><s%>.

Then he made him that remaineth <S%H8300><s%> have dominion <S%H7287><s%> over the nobles <S%H117><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%>: the LORD <S%H3068><s%> made me have dominion <S%H7287><s%> over the mighty <S%H1368><s%>.

Out of Ephraim <S%H669><s%> was there a root <S%H8328><s%> of them against Amalek <S%H6002><s%>; after <S%H310><s%> thee, Benjamin <S%H1144><s%>, among thy people <S%H5971><s%>; out of Machir <S%H4353><s%> came down <S%H3381><s%> governors <S%H2710><s%>, and out of Zebulun <S%H2074><s%> they that handle <S%H4900><s%> the pen <S%H7626><s%> of the writer <S%H5608><s%>.

And the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Issachar <S%H3485><s%> were with Deborah <S%H1683><s%>; even Issachar <S%H3485><s%>, and also Barak <S%H1301><s%>: he was sent <S%H7971><s%> on foot <S%H7272><s%> into the valley <S%H6010><s%>. For the divisions <S%H6390><s%> of Reuben <S%H7205><s%> there were great <S%H1419><s%> thoughts <S%H2711><s%> of heart <S%H3820><s%>.

Why abodest <S%H3427><s%> thou among <S%H996><s%> the sheepfolds <S%H4942><s%>, to hear <S%H8085><s%> the bleatings <S%H8292><s%> of the flocks <S%H5739><s%>? For the divisions <S%H6390><s%> of Reuben <S%H7205><s%> there were great <S%H1419><s%> searchings <S%H2714><s%> of heart <S%H3820><s%>.

Gilead <S%H1568><s%> abode <S%H7931><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> Jordan <S%H3383><s%>: and why did Dan <S%H1835><s%> remain <S%H1481><s%> in ships <S%H591><s%>? Asher <S%H836><s%> continued <S%H3427><s%> on the sea <S%H3220><s%> shore <S%H2348><s%>, and abode <S%H7931><s%> in his breaches <S%H4664><s%>.

Zebulun <S%H2074><s%> and Naphtali <S%H5321><s%> were a people <S%H5971><s%> that jeoparded <S%H2778><s%> their lives <S%H5315><s%> unto the death <S%H4191><s%> in the high places <S%H4791><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>.

The kings <S%H4428><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and fought <S%H3898><s%>, then fought <S%H3898><s%> the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%> in Taanach <S%H8590><s%> by the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Megiddo <S%H4023><s%>; they took <S%H3947><s%> no gain <S%H1215><s%> of money <S%H3701><s%>.
They fought <S%H3898><s%> from heaven <S%H8064><s%>; the stars <S%H3556><s%> in their courses <S%H4546><s%> fought <S%H3898><s%> against Sisera <S%H5516><s%>.

The river <S%H5158><s%> of Kishon <S%H7028><s%> swept them away <S%H1640><s%>, that ancient <S%H6917><s%> river <S%H5158><s%>, the river <S%H5158><s%> Kishon <S%H7028><s%>. O my soul <S%H5315><s%>, thou hast trodden down <S%H1869><s%> strength <S%H5797><s%>.
Then were the horsehoofs <S%H6119><s%> <S%H5483><s%> broken <S%H1986><s%> by the means of the pransings <S%H1726><s%>, the pransings <S%H1726><s%> of their mighty ones <S%H47><s%>.

Curse <S%H779><s%> ye Meroz <S%H4789><s%>, said <S%H559><s%> the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, curse <S%H779><s%> ye bitterly <S%H779><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> thereof; because they came <S%H935><s%> not to the help <S%H5833><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, to the help <S%H5833><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> against the mighty <S%H1368><s%>.

Blessed <S%H1288><s%> above women <S%H802><s%> shall Jael <S%H3278><s%> the wife <S%H802><s%> of Heber <S%H2268><s%> the Kenite <S%H7017><s%> be, blessed <S%H1288><s%> shall she be above women <S%H802><s%> in the tent <S%H168><s%>.
He asked <S%H7592><s%> water <S%H4325><s%>, and she gave <S%H5414><s%> him milk <S%H2461><s%>; she brought forth <S%H7126><s%> butter <S%H2529><s%> in a lordly <S%H117><s%> dish <S%H5602><s%>.

She put <S%H7971><s%> her hand <S%H3027><s%> to the nail <S%H3489><s%>, and her right hand <S%H3225><s%> to the workmen's <S%H6001><s%> hammer <S%H1989><s%>; and with the hammer she smote <S%H1986><s%> Sisera <S%H5516><s%>, she smote off <S%H4277><s%> his head <S%H7218><s%>, when she had pierced <S%H4272><s%> and stricken through <S%H2498><s%> his temples <S%H7541><s%>.

At her feet <S%H7272><s%> he bowed <S%H3766><s%>, he fell <S%H5307><s%>, he lay down <S%H7901><s%>: at her feet <S%H7272><s%> he bowed <S%H3766><s%>, he fell <S%H5307><s%>: where <S%H834><s%> he bowed <S%H3766><s%>, there he fell down <S%H5307><s%> dead <S%H7703><s%>.

The mother <S%H517><s%> of Sisera <S%H5516><s%> looked <S%H8259><s%> out at a window <S%H2474><s%>, and cried <S%H2980><s%> through the lattice <S%H822><s%>, Why is his chariot <S%H7393><s%> so long <S%H954><s%> in coming <S%H935><s%>? why tarry <S%H309><s%> the wheels <S%H6471><s%> of his chariots <S%H4818><s%>?
Her wise <S%H2450><s%> ladies <S%H8282><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> her, yea, she returned <S%H7725><s%> answer <S%H561><s%> to herself,

Have they not sped <S%H4672><s%>? have they not divided <S%H2505><s%> the prey <S%H7998><s%>; to every <S%H7218><s%> man <S%H1397><s%> a damsel <S%H7356><s%> or two <S%H7361><s%>; to Sisera <S%H5516><s%> a prey <S%H7998><s%> of divers colours <S%H6648><s%>, a prey <S%H7998><s%> of divers colours <S%H6648><s%> of needlework <S%H7553><s%>, of divers colours <S%H6648><s%> of needlework on both sides <S%H7553><s%>, meet for the necks <S%H6677><s%> of them that take the spoil <S%H7998><s%>?

So let all thine enemies <S%H341><s%> perish <S%H6><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>: but let them that love <S%H157><s%> him be as the sun <S%H8121><s%> when he goeth forth <S%H3318><s%> in his might <S%H1369><s%>. And the land <S%H776><s%> had rest <S%H8252><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>.
